org.apache.bookkeeper.client.api

Interface WriteHandle

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Handle, ReadHandle
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LedgerHandle, LedgerHandleAdv, ReadOnlyLedgerHandle

    @InterfaceAudience.Public
 @InterfaceStability.Unstable
public interface WriteHandle
extends ReadHandle
    Provide write access to a ledger.
    Since:
    4.6
    See Also:
    WriteAdvHandle

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default CompletableFuture<Long> append(byte[] data)
      Add an entry asynchronously to an open ledger.
      default CompletableFuture<Long> append(byte[] data, int offset, int length)
      Add an entry asynchronously to an open ledger.
      CompletableFuture<Long> append(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf data)
      Add entry asynchronously to an open ledger.
      default CompletableFuture<Long> append(ByteBuffer data)
      Add entry asynchronously to an open ledger.
      long getLastAddPushed()
      Get the entry id of the last entry that has been enqueued for addition (but may not have possibly been persisted to the ledger).

      • Methods inherited from interface org.apache.bookkeeper.client.api.ReadHandle

        getLastAddConfirmed, getLength, isClosed, read, readLastAddConfirmed, readLastAddConfirmedAndEntry, readUnconfirmed, tryReadLastAddConfirmed

      • Methods inherited from interface org.apache.bookkeeper.client.api.Handle

        asyncClose, close, getId, getLedgerMetadata

    • Method Detail

      • append

        CompletableFuture<Long> append(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf data)
        Add entry asynchronously to an open ledger.
        Parameters:
        data - a bytebuf to be written. The bytebuf's reference count will be decremented by 1 after the completable future is returned
        Returns:
        an handle to the result, in case of success it will return the id of the newly appended entry

      • append

        default CompletableFuture<Long> append(ByteBuffer data)
        Add entry asynchronously to an open ledger.
        Parameters:
        data - array of bytes to be written
        Returns:
        an handle to the result, in case of success it will return the id of the newly appended entry

      • append

        default CompletableFuture<Long> append(byte[] data)
        Add an entry asynchronously to an open ledger.
        Parameters:
        data - array of bytes to be written
        Returns:
        a completable future represents the add result, in case of success the future returns the entry id of this newly appended entry

      • append

        default CompletableFuture<Long> append(byte[] data,
                                       int offset,
                                       int length)
        Add an entry asynchronously to an open ledger.
        Parameters:
        data - array of bytes to be written
        offset - the offset in the bytes array
        length - the length of the bytes to be appended
        Returns:
        a completable future represents the add result, in case of success the future returns the entry id of this newly appended entry

      • getLastAddPushed

        long getLastAddPushed()
        Get the entry id of the last entry that has been enqueued for addition (but may not have possibly been persisted to the ledger).
        Returns:
        the entry id of the last entry pushed or -1 if no entry has been pushed
